translated: “Nephew, where are you going?”🔽“I’m going to gather wood.”

original: kho bo cag ji tsam du sngar dong na yang da 'khor ba yin na /
analyzed: kho bo cag ji tsam du sngar dong na yang da 'khor ba yin na /
translated: “We’ve been going around and around for a long time,🔽so when will you come back?”

original: khyod da song @111b na nam zhig 'khor bar 'gyur zhes de dag gis de la shing re re byin no //
analyzed: khyod da song @111b na nam zhig 'khor bar 'gyur zhes de dag gis de la shing re re byin no //
translated: They gave him a piece of wood each.

original: shing re re bo de dag gis khye'u de'i shing khur longs nas des de khyer te phyir log go /
analyzed: shing re re bo de dag gis khye'u de'i shing khur longs nas des de khyer te phyir log go /
translated: The boy took up the load of wood from each of the wood-gatherers, and he carried it for them.

original: des de dag btsongs te sran ma dag nyos nas de dag brngos te chu grang mos bum pa bkang nas yang phyogs de nyid du song ste bsdad pa dang / shing thun de dag kyang lhags nas /
analyzed: des de dag btsongs te sran ma dag nyos nas de dag brngos te chu grang mos bum pa bkang nas yang phyogs de nyid du song ste bsdad pa dang / shing thun de dag kyang lhags nas /
translated: He sold it and bought beans, which he boiled. He filled a pot with cold water and went back to the same place.

original: des de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: des de dag la smras pa /
translated: The wood-gatherers arrived and he said to them,

original: zhang po dag shing khur zhog la yud tsam zhig ngal sos shig /
analyzed: zhang po dag shing khur zhog la yud tsam zhig ngal sos shig /
translated: “Unpack your loads of wood, uncles, and rest for a while.”

original: de nas shing thun de dag gis shing khur dag bzhag pa dang / khye'u de yang de dag la sran ma dag gis bgo bsha' byas shing /
analyzed: de nas shing thun de dag gis shing khur dag bzhag pa dang / khye'u de yang de dag la sran ma dag gis bgo bsha' byas shing /
translated: Then the wood-gatherers put down their loads of wood, and the boy shared the beans with them.

original: chu grang mos ngoms par byas pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: chu grang mos ngoms par byas pa dang / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: He satisfied them with cold water, and they said,

original: tsha bo khyod nyin gcig bzhin du sran ma dang chu thogs la 'di nyid du sdod cig dang / kho bo cag gis khyod la shing khur gyi gong shing khyer te 'ong ngo //
analyzed: tsha bo khyod nyin gcig bzhin du sran ma dang chu thogs la 'di nyid du sdod cig dang / kho bo cag gis khyod la shing khur gyi gong shing khyer te 'ong ngo //
translated: “Nephew, you should stay here every day, bringing beans and water, and we will bring you the price of your load of wood.”

original: khye'u des nyi ma re re zhing de bzhin bya bar brtsams nas des de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: khye'u des nyi ma re re zhing de bzhin bya bar brtsams nas des de dag la smras pa /
translated: The young man did as he had been told, day after day. He said to them,

original: zhang po dag khyed cag shing khur dag tshong 'dus su ma khyer bar kho bo'i sdum par zhog cig dang / kho bos khyed cag la rin bsdoms te byin no //
analyzed: zhang po dag khyed cag shing khur dag tshong 'dus su ma khyer bar kho bo'i sdum par zhog cig dang / kho bos khyed cag la rin bsdoms te byin no //
translated: “Uncles, don’t take your loads of wood to market. Leave them at my house and I will give you a price for them.”

original: de dag gis shing khur de dag de'i khyim du bzhag go /
analyzed: de dag gis shing khur de dag de'i khyim du bzhag go /
translated: They left their loads of wood at his house.

original: dus gzhan zhig na nyi ma bdun du yul ngan byung nas khye'u des shing de dag btsongs pa dang / des khe sbogs mang po grub bo //
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na nyi ma bdun du yul ngan byung nas khye'u des shing de dag btsongs pa dang / des khe sbogs mang po grub bo //
translated: Then, after seven days of bad weather, the young man sold the wood and made a large profit.

original: de nas khye'u des bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas khye'u des bsams pa /
translated: Then the young man thought,

original: tshong pa rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste shing 'tshong ba 'di ni tha chad yin te 'di ltar tsan dan gyis 'tsho na yang shing gis 'tsho ba kho nar zad pas bdag @112a *//
analyzed: tshong pa rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste shing 'tshong ba 'di ni tha chad yin te 'di ltar tsan dan gyis 'tsho na yang shing gis 'tsho ba kho nar zad pas bdag @112a *//
translated: “Among merchants, this is the worst: to be a wood merchant. Even if you live on sandalwood, you still live on wood.

original: gis bza' bca'i zong dgram par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: gis bza' bca'i zong dgram par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I will trade in food.”

original: des bza' bca'i zong dgram zhing de chos dang rigs pas tshong byed pas de der yang khe sbogs mang po grub par gyur to //
analyzed: des bza' bca'i zong dgram zhing de chos dang rigs pas tshong byed pas de der yang khe sbogs mang po grub par gyur to //
translated: He sold food and drink there, and he did so in a way that was in accord with the Dharma and with logic. He also made a great deal of profit there.

original: des yang bsams pa /
analyzed: des yang bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: tshong pa rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste bza' bca' 'tshong pa 'di ni tha chad yin gyi /
analyzed: tshong pa rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste bza' bca' 'tshong pa 'di ni tha chad yin gyi /
translated: “Among merchants, selling food and drink is the worst.

original: bdag gis spos 'tshong gi zong dgram par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag gis spos 'tshong gi zong dgram par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I will sell incense.”

original: des spos 'tshong gi zong dgram zhing des chos dang rigs pas tshong byed pas des der yang khe spogs mang po grub par gyur to //
analyzed: des spos 'tshong gi zong dgram zhing des chos dang rigs pas tshong byed pas des der yang khe spogs mang po grub par gyur to //
translated: He sold incense there, and he did so in a way that was in accord with the Dharma and with logic. He also made a great deal of profit there.

original: des yang bsams pa /
analyzed: des yang bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: tshong pa rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste spos 'tshong 'di ni tha chad yin gyi /
analyzed: tshong pa rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste spos 'tshong 'di ni tha chad yin gyi /
translated: “Among merchants, selling incense is the worst.

original: bdag gis dbyig gi zong dgram par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag gis dbyig gi zong dgram par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: I will sell gold.”

original: des dbyig gi zong dgram zhing des chos dang rigs pas tshong byed pas des dbyig tshong pa thams cad zil gyis mnan nas /
analyzed: des dbyig gi zong dgram zhing des chos dang rigs pas tshong byed pas des dbyig tshong pa thams cad zil gyis mnan nas /
translated: He sold gold there, and he did so in a way that was in accord with the Dharma and with logic. He outshone all the gold merchants.

original: de'i ming byi dbyig pa byi dbyig pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i ming byi dbyig pa byi dbyig pa zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: He was named Bṛhaspati.

original: dbyig tshong pa de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: dbyig tshong pa de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The merchants said,

original: byi dbyig pa 'dis bdag cag thams cad zil gyis mnan gyi /
analyzed: byi dbyig pa 'dis bdag cag thams cad zil gyis mnan gyi /
translated: “This Bṛhaspati has surpassed all of us.

original: ci nas kyang 'di rgya mtsho chen por 'jug cing der tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba de ltar nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: ci nas kyang 'di rgya mtsho chen por 'jug cing der tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba de ltar nga rgyal bskyed par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: We must make him feel proud so that he will enter the great ocean and there meet with misfortune.”

original: de dang ha cang thag mi ring bar 'khod de longs gtam smra bas 'khod cing /
analyzed: de dang ha cang thag mi ring bar 'khod de longs gtam smra bas 'khod cing /
translated: They sat down not far from him and began to chat.

original: shes ldan dag 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: shes ldan dag 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “Sirs, it is like this.

original: mi glang po che'i gnyar zhon nas rta'i rgyab tu zhon pa dang / rta'i rgyab tu zhon nas khyogs spyil la zhon pa dang / khyogs spyil @112b la zhon nas rkang pas 'gro ba de bzhin du byi dbyig pa 'di yang pha mes dag rgya mtsho chen por gru bo che spyod cing 'gro bar gyur pa las 'di da ltar dbyig tshong nyid kyis tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba sbyor bar byed do
analyzed: mi glang po che'i gnyar zhon nas rta'i rgyab tu zhon pa dang / rta'i rgyab tu zhon nas khyogs spyil la zhon pa dang / khyogs spyil @112b la zhon nas rkang pas 'gro ba de bzhin du byi dbyig pa 'di yang pha mes dag rgya mtsho chen por gru bo che spyod cing 'gro bar gyur pa las 'di da ltar dbyig tshong nyid kyis tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba sbyor bar byed do
translated: The son of a former sea captain is now making a living as a peddler of trinkets.”

original: zhes smras pa dang / byi dbyig pas thos nas des smras pa /
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / byi dbyig pas thos nas des smras pa /
translated: When the peddler heard this, he said,

original: shes ldan dag ci zer /
analyzed: shes ldan dag ci zer /
translated: “Sirs, what are you saying?”

original: khyod kyi pha mes dag rgya mtsho chen por gru bo che spyod cing 'gro bar gyur ba las der yang de dag shi nas khyod dbyig tshong tsam gyis tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: khyod kyi pha mes dag rgya mtsho chen por gru bo che spyod cing 'gro bar gyur ba las der yang de dag shi nas khyod dbyig tshong tsam gyis tshegs chen pos 'tsho ba sbyor bar byed do //
translated: “Your ancestors were sea captains who sailed the great ocean in large ships. They died there, and now you are making a living as a peddler of trinkets.”

original: byi dbyig pa khyim du song ste ma la dris pa /
analyzed: byi dbyig pa khyim du song ste ma la dris pa /
translated: The peddler went home and asked his mother,🔽“Mother, did my ancestors sail the great ocean in large ships?”

original: ma kho bo'i pha mes dag rgya mtsho chen por gru bo che spyod par gyur pa bden nam /
analyzed: ma kho bo'i pha mes dag rgya mtsho chen por gru bo che spyod par gyur pa bden nam /
translated: “Mother, is it true that my ancestors sailed the great ocean in large ships?”

original: mas bsams pa /
analyzed: mas bsams pa /
translated: The mother thought,

original: 'dis 'ga' zhig las thos par gyur gor ma chag gi /
analyzed: 'dis 'ga' zhig las thos par gyur gor ma chag gi /
translated: “He must have heard this from someone.

original: 'di la rdzun gyi tshig smra ba ni bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di la rdzun gyi tshig smra ba ni bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no snyam nas /
translated: It is not right for me to tell him a lie.”

original: des smras pa /🔽bu bden no //
analyzed: des smras pa / bu bden no //
translated: So she said,🔽“Son, it is true.”

original: byi dbyig pas smras pa /
analyzed: byi dbyig pas smras pa /
translated: The son said,

original: ma bdag kyang rgya mtsho chen por 'jug gi gnong zhig /
analyzed: ma bdag kyang rgya mtsho chen por 'jug gi gnong zhig /
translated: “Mother, I too will go to sea.

original: mas smras pa bu 'di nyid du 'dug cig /
analyzed: mas smras pa bu 'di nyid du 'dug cig /
translated: ” The mother said, “Son, stay here.”

original: byi dbyig pas yang dang yang du 'gro'o zhes smras pa dang / mas de dus kyis 'chu bar shes nas gnang ngo /
analyzed: byi dbyig pas yang dang yang du 'gro'o zhes smras pa dang / mas de dus kyis 'chu bar shes nas gnang ngo /
translated: The son said, “I will go again and again,” and the mother, knowing that he would not be dissuaded, gave her consent.🔽The son went to the marketplace and said to the merchants,

original: byi dbyig pas srang chen por tshong pa'i tshogs rnams la /
analyzed: byi dbyig pas srang chen por tshong pa'i tshogs rnams la /
translated: “Sirs, I will go to the great ocean.”

original: khyed cag las gang ded dpon byi dbyig pa dang lhan cig sho gam med pa dang / la gcan med pa dang / gru btsas med par rgya mtsho chen por 'jug par spro ba des rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i zong sta gon gyis shig ces dril bsgrag par bya'o //
analyzed: khyed cag las gang ded dpon byi dbyig pa dang lhan cig sho gam med pa dang / la gcan med pa dang / gru btsas med par rgya mtsho chen por 'jug par spro ba des rgya mtsho chen por 'gro ba'i zong sta gon gyis shig ces dril bsgrag par bya'o //
translated: He should proclaim: Those of you who are willing to go to sea with the sea captain Dharmalabdha, without customs, without tolls, and without sea tax, should prepare your goods for the great ocean.

original: de nas tshong pa lnga brgya tsam gyis rgya mtsho chen por 'gro @113a *//🔽ba'i zong sta gon byas so //
analyzed: de nas tshong pa lnga brgya tsam gyis rgya mtsho chen por 'gro @113a *// ba'i zong sta gon byas so //
translated: Then about five hundred merchants prepared goods for the great ocean.

original: de nas ded dpon byi dbyig pas dge mtshan dang bkra shis dang dge bar 'gyur ba byas te shing rta dag dang / khur dag dang / spyad dag dang / gle ba dag dang / rnga mo dag dang / ba lang dag dang / bong bu dag la zong mang po bkal te tshong pa de dag dang lhan cig rgya mtsho chen por 'phags so //
analyzed: de nas ded dpon byi dbyig pas dge mtshan dang bkra shis dang dge bar 'gyur ba byas te shing rta dag dang / khur dag dang / spyad dag dang / gle ba dag dang / rnga mo dag dang / ba lang dag dang / bong bu dag la zong mang po bkal te tshong pa de dag dang lhan cig rgya mtsho chen por 'phags so //
translated: Then the sea captain Dharmalabdha, having performed auspicious rites, auspicious acts, and virtuous acts, loaded many goods onto carts, onto loads, onto pack animals, onto camels, onto cows, and onto donkeys, and set out to the great ocean together with those merchants.

original: de na de la mi lnga yod de sdud par byed pa dang / tshar gcod par byed pa dang / byi dor ba dang / chu phyags pa dang / rlung yor thogs pa'o //
analyzed: de na de la mi lnga yod de sdud par byed pa dang / tshar gcod par byed pa dang / byi dor ba dang / chu phyags pa dang / rlung yor thogs pa'o //
translated: There are five people on the ship: the captain, the helmsman, the lookout, the cook, and the sailor.

original: sdud par byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdud par byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the captain?

original: de na bza' ba dang btung ba sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de na bza' ba dang btung ba sbyor ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the one who prepares the food and drink.

original: tshar gcod par byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshar gcod par byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the helmsman?

original: de na rtsod pa byung ngo cog nye bar zhi bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de na rtsod pa byung ngo cog nye bar zhi bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the one who calms all disputes that arise.

original: byi dor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: byi dor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the lookout?

original: gru 'chos par byed par gang yin pa'o /
analyzed: gru 'chos par byed par gang yin pa'o /
translated: It is the one who repairs the ship.

original: chu phyags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chu phyags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cook?

original: de na chu phyags par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de na chu phyags par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the one who cooks the food.

original: rlung yor thogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rlung yor thogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the sailor?

original: de na rgyu skar dag la rnam par lta bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de na rgyu skar dag la rnam par lta bar byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the one who watches the stars.

original: de mthar gyis rgya mtsho'i 'gram du phyin pa dang / tshong pa de dag gis rgya mtsho chen po mthong nas skrag ste gru bo cher po 'jug par mi spro nas /
analyzed: de mthar gyis rgya mtsho'i 'gram du phyin pa dang / tshong pa de dag gis rgya mtsho chen po mthong nas skrag ste gru bo cher po 'jug par mi spro nas /
translated: After a while they reached the ocean shore, and when the merchants saw the great ocean, they were frightened and did not want to enter the great ship.

original: ded dpon byi dbyig pas rlung yor thogs pa la smras pa /
analyzed: ded dpon byi dbyig pas rlung yor thogs pa la smras pa /
translated: The captain said to the helmsman,

original: kva'e nang rje rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgrogs shig /
analyzed: kva'e nang rje rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgrogs shig /
translated: “Hey, you there, praise the great ocean as it is.”

original: de nas rlung yor thogs pas bsgrag par brtsams pa /
analyzed: de nas rlung yor thogs pas bsgrag par brtsams pa /
translated: Then the helmsman began to proclaim,

original: 'dzam bu gling pa'i tshong pa shes ldan dag nyon cig /
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling pa'i tshong pa shes ldan dag nyon cig /
translated: “Sirs, merchants of Jambudvīpa, listen!

original: rgya mtsho chen @113b po 'di ni /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen @113b po 'di ni /
translated: This great ocean

analyzed: rin po che chen po che ba 'di lta bu 'di lta ste nor bu dag dang / mu tig dang / beed'urya dang / man shel dkar po dang / byu ru dang / dngul dang / sa le sbram dang / rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang /
translated: has great jewels such as these: pearls, beryl, white crystal, coral, silver, gold, cat’s eyes, sapphires,

original: dmar po dang / g-yas su 'khyil ba dag yod kyi /
analyzed: dmar po dang / g-yas su 'khyil ba dag yod kyi /
translated: and right-spiraling conches.

analyzed: khyed cag las gang rin po che de lta bu dag gis bdag nyid dang / pha ma dang / bu dang chung ma dang / bran dang / bran mo dang las byed pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dang / mdza' bshes dang / blon po dang nye du dang /
translated: “Those among you who wish to satisfy themselves, their parents, children, wives, slaves, servants, workers, and laborers, friends, ministers, relatives,

original: snag gi gnyen mtshams dag legs par bde bas tshim par bya ba dang / dus dang dus su dge sbyong dang bram ze dag la mthon por 'gro ba dang / skal ba can du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa bde ba dang / phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gro ba'i yon 'bul bar 'dod pa de rgya mtsho chen por zhugs shig /
analyzed: snag gi gnyen mtshams dag legs par bde bas tshim par bya ba dang / dus dang dus su dge sbyong dang bram ze dag la mthon por 'gro ba dang / skal ba can du 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa bde ba dang / phyi ma la mtho ris su 'gro ba'i yon 'bul bar 'dod pa de rgya mtsho chen por zhugs shig /
translated: and blood relations with such jewels, and who wish to offer timely gifts to ascetics and brahmins that will lead to a high rebirth, to good fortune, to a happy ripening, and to rebirth in the higher realms in the future, should set out on the great ocean.

original: 'jig rten ni 'byor ba 'dod pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs gru bo cher zhugs pa dang / des de dag gru bo ches mi bzod par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni 'byor ba 'dod pas skye bo phal po che'i tshogs gru bo cher zhugs pa dang / des de dag gru bo ches mi bzod par gyur nas /
translated: The world desires wealth, so a great many people set out on the great ocean in ships.

original: ded dpon byi dbyig pas bsams pa /
analyzed: ded dpon byi dbyig pas bsams pa /
translated: The captain Yudhājit thought,

original: da bdag gis phyir zhugs shig ces ji skad smra bar bya snyam nas /
analyzed: da bdag gis phyir zhugs shig ces ji skad smra bar bya snyam nas /
translated: Now I will go back in.”

original: des rlung yor thogs pa la smras pa /
analyzed: des rlung yor thogs pa la smras pa /
translated: He said to the helmsman,

original: kva'e nang rje rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgrogs shig /
analyzed: kva'e nang rje rgya mtsho chen po'i bsngags pa ma yin pa ji lta ba bzhin du sgrogs shig /
translated: “Hey, you there! Announce the ocean’s faults as they are.”

original: de nas rlung yor thogs pas bsgrag par brtsams pa /
analyzed: de nas rlung yor thogs pas bsgrag par brtsams pa /
translated: Then the helmsman announced,

original: 'dzam bu gling pa'i tshong pa shes ldan dag nyon cig /
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling pa'i tshong pa shes ldan dag nyon cig /
translated: “Sirs, merchants of Jambudvīpa, listen!

original: rgya mtsho chen po 'di na 'jigs pa chen po che ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po 'di na 'jigs pa chen po che ba 'di lta ste /
translated: In this great ocean there are great dangers, such as

analyzed: nya chen gyi 'jigs pa dang / nya chen @114a *//
translated: the danger of the great fish,🔽the danger of the great fish swallowing the fish,

original: mid kyi 'jigs pa dang / nya chen mid pa mid kyi 'jigs pa dang / chu rlabs kyi 'jigs pa dang / dba' klong gi 'jigs pa dang / chu srin kumbhi ra'i 'jigs pa dang / chu srin byis pa gsod kyi 'jigs pa dang / chu'i nang nas byung ba'i ri dvags la thug pa'i 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: mid kyi 'jigs pa dang / nya chen mid pa mid kyi 'jigs pa dang / chu rlabs kyi 'jigs pa dang / dba' klong gi 'jigs pa dang / chu srin kumbhi ra'i 'jigs pa dang / chu srin byis pa gsod kyi 'jigs pa dang / chu'i nang nas byung ba'i ri dvags la thug pa'i 'jigs pa dang /
translated: the danger of the fish swallowing the fish swallowing the fish, the danger of the waves, the danger of the whirlpools, the danger of the sea monsters, the danger of the sea monsters that kill children, the danger of the deer that emerge from the water,

original: rlung nag po'i 'jigs pa dag yod cing /
analyzed: rlung nag po'i 'jigs pa dag yod cing /

translated: the lion of the Śākyas, the chief king of the Śākyas, to be foremost among those skilled in transforming the mind.” By the power of that aspiration, he is now declared by the Thus-Gone One to be foremost among those skilled in transforming the mind.

original: // dge slong dag de ltar na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gcig tu gnag pa yin la /
analyzed: // dge slong dag de ltar na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa gcig tu gnag pa yin la /

analyzed: las gcig tu dkar ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yang gcig tu dkar pa yin /

analyzed: las 'dren ma rnams kyi rnam par smin pa yang 'dren ma yin no //
translated: The karmic maturation of mixed actions is mixed.

analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na las gcig tu gnag pa dang 'dren ma rnams spangs te las gcig tu dkar ba rnams la brtsal bar bya ste /
translated: Monks, therefore, you should abandon entirely dark and mixed actions and strive for entirely bright actions.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o //

analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for a beginner, for one who is insane, for one who is deranged, or for one who is overwhelmed by pain.

analyzed: ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu gcig pa rdzogs so ////

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la soms shig /

analyzed: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la rjes su ston cig /

analyzed: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis shig ces bka' stsal nas /

analyzed: de nas autpa la'i mdog 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed ga la ba der song ste /

analyzed: phyin nas tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis bsams pa /

analyzed: bud med kyi yul ni shes rab chung ba yin no snyam nas des de la don dang tshig dang yi ge mdor 'dus pa 'dus pa dag gis chos bstan to //

analyzed: de dag gis de'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: They bowed their heads at his two feet,

analyzed: stan las langs te dong ba dang / ji tsam na mnyan yod kyi sgo dag bcad par gyur nas dge slong ma rnams kyis sgo btsal ba dang / sgo bas smras pa /

analyzed: sgo bcad lags so //

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: phye shig / lde mig dag rgyal po'i pho brang du 'tshal to //

analyzed: de dag gis bsams pa /

analyzed: 'di nyid du 'khod do snyam nas mnyan yod dang ha cang mi ring ba na kun dga' ra ba zhig 'dug pa der de dag dong @128a *//

analyzed: ngo // bcom ldan 'das kyis shing ljon pa yang rgan rims kyis bsko bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal pas de dag gis shing ljon pa dag rgan rigs kyis bsko bar brtsams pa dang / de na de dag shing ljon pa dag sgo ba rnams la aa yya aa yya aa ha da aag ae aa ga ha de zhes 'bod pa'i sgra mthon po dang sgra chen po byung ngo //

analyzed: shes ldan dag mnyan yod re zhig sdod cig /

original: autpa la'i mdog gis bsams pa /
analyzed: autpa la'i mdog gis bsams pa /

analyzed: mi mdzes pa 'ga' zhig gis rig par mi 'gyur ram snyam na /

analyzed: shes ldan dag bdag cag 'phags skyes po'i dpung gis bskor te bdag cag zin par gyur na mi rung gi /

original: 'bros par bya'o zhes de ltar rig nas de dag bros so //
analyzed: 'bros par bya'o zhes de ltar rig nas de dag bros so //

original: autpa la'i mdog gis dge slong ma de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: autpa la'i mdog gis dge slong ma de dag la smras pa /

analyzed: nu mo dag g-yon can 'joms par 'dod pa lnga brgya tsam 'dir lhags nas kho mos de dag bsdigs nas bros kyi /

analyzed: khad kyis dal bu dal bus lag brdas sgo phye shig /

analyzed: dag nang phar sngar @128b langs te mnyan yod du zhugs pa dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag gis mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed la rmas pa /

analyzed: btsun pa med do //

translated: There is no offense if the teacher is listening to the Dharma all night, or if he is in the gateway to the temple, or if the door is not closed, or if the temple or the rainy-season retreat house is in the city, or if he has gone to another house to see the teacher.

translated: There is no offense if it is the first offense, or if he is insane, or if his mind is disturbed, or if he is overwhelmed by pain.

original: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks, feeling doubtful, inquired of the Buddha, the Blessed One, the One who Severs all Doubts,

original: btsun pa autpa la'i mdog gis dge slong ma lnga brgya g-yon can gyi 'jigs pa las yongs su bskyabs pa la gzigs /
analyzed: btsun pa autpa la'i mdog gis dge slong ma lnga brgya g-yon can gyi 'jigs pa las yongs su bskyabs pa la gzigs /
translated: “How is it, O Venerable One, that Utpalavarna has saved five hundred nuns from the danger of being seduced?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag da ltar du ma zad de /
analyzed: dge slong dag da ltar du ma zad de /
translated: “Monks, this is not the first time she has done this.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus na yang 'dis don mthun mang po seng ge'i 'jigs pa las yongs su bskyabs par gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa'i dus na yang 'dis don mthun mang po seng ge'i 'jigs pa las yongs su bskyabs par gyur te /
translated: In this way, in the past as well, he saved many people from the danger of lions.

original: de nyon cig /
analyzed: de nyon cig /
translated: “Listen to that.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na ri brags shig na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na ri brags shig na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: “Monks, in the past, in a certain mountain village, there lived a householder. He took a wife from a family of equal rank, and he enjoyed himself with her with the five kinds of sensual pleasures.🔽He played with her,

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: and he had sex with her.

original: des chung ma la smras pa bzang mo kho bo zong thogs te yul gzhan du 'gro'o //
analyzed: des chung ma la smras pa bzang mo kho bo zong thogs te yul gzhan du 'gro'o //
translated: He said to his wife, ‘My dear, I’m going to another country with my merchandise.’

original: chung mas smras pa /
analyzed: chung mas smras pa /
translated: His wife said,

original: rje'i sras bdag kyang mchi'o //
analyzed: rje'i sras bdag kyang mchi'o //
translated: ‘My lord, I’m coming with you.’

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: lam du khyod kyi g-yog sus byed par @130a *//
analyzed: lam du khyod kyi g-yog sus byed par @130a *//
translated: ‘Who will take care of you on the road?

original: 'gyur / khyod 'di nyid du 'dug cig /
analyzed: 'gyur / khyod 'di nyid du 'dug cig /
translated: You should stay here.’

original: chung mas bdag mi khrid do snyam nas du bar brtsams pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dag gis khyim bdag la dris pa /
analyzed: chung mas bdag mi khrid do snyam nas du bar brtsams pa dang / zho shas 'tsho ba dag gis khyim bdag la dris pa /
translated: Thinking, ‘He’s not taking me,’ she began to cry. The servants asked the householder,🔽‘Why is she crying?’

original: jo bo sa ci'i slad du 'di dur stsal /
analyzed: jo bo sa ci'i slad du 'di dur stsal /
translated: The elder asked, Why is he buried here?

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said, He was a merchant.

original: mi khrid do snyam nas so //🔽de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: mi khrid do snyam nas so // de dag gis smras pa /
translated: I thought he was not to be taken.

original: ci'i slad du mi bkri /🔽khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: ci'i slad du mi bkri / khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: They said, Why is he not to be taken?

original: der 'di'i g-yog su byed par 'gyur /🔽de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: der 'di'i g-yog su byed par 'gyur / de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said, Who will be his attendant there?

original: der bdag cag gis 'di'i g-yog bgyi'o //
analyzed: der bdag cag gis 'di'i g-yog bgyi'o //
translated: They said, We will be his attendants there.

original: khyim bdag gis de khrid de song nas don mthun de dag dgon pa'i lam zhig tu mtshan mo btab pa dang / don mthun de dag lam gyis dub pas nyal nas khyim bdag gi chung ma de mel tshe byed do //
analyzed: khyim bdag gis de khrid de song nas don mthun de dag dgon pa'i lam zhig tu mtshan mo btab pa dang / don mthun de dag lam gyis dub pas nyal nas khyim bdag gi chung ma de mel tshe byed do //
translated: The householder took him and went. Those merchants stopped for the night on a road in the wilderness. Those merchants, exhausted from the road, went to sleep. The householder's wife was keeping watch.

original: ji tsam na der seng ge 'ongs nas de sa mgal dum thogs te de bsdigs pa dang bros par 'gyur nas /
analyzed: ji tsam na der seng ge 'ongs nas de sa mgal dum thogs te de bsdigs pa dang bros par 'gyur nas /
translated: Then a lion came there. She took up a clod of earth and threatened it, and it ran away.

original: lhas tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /🔽gang phyir bya ba thams cad la //
analyzed: lhas tshigs su bcad pa smras pa / gang phyir bya ba thams cad la //
translated: A god spoke this verse:🔽Not only men are wise

original: skyes pa 'ba' zhig mkhas pa min //
analyzed: skyes pa 'ba' zhig mkhas pa min //
translated: in all activities.

original: de dang de la bud med kyang //
analyzed: de dang de la bud med kyang //
translated: In this and that, women

original: zin la mkhas pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: zin la mkhas pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: also become wise when they seize it.

original: dge slong dag de'i tshe de'i dus na khyim bdag gi chung ma gang yin pa de ni autpa la'i mdog 'di nyid yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de'i tshe de'i dus na khyim bdag gi chung ma gang yin pa de ni autpa la'i mdog 'di nyid yin la /
translated: “Monks, the one who was the wife of the householder then is none other than Utpalavarṇā.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na don mthun lnga brgya gang yin pa de dag ni dge slong ma lnga brgya po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na don mthun lnga brgya gang yin pa de dag ni dge slong ma lnga brgya po 'di dag yin te /
translated: The five hundred merchants then are none other than these five hundred nuns.

original: de'i tshe na yang 'dis don mthun mang pos seng ge'i 'jigs pa las yongs su bskyabs par gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe na yang 'dis don mthun mang pos seng ge'i 'jigs pa las yongs su bskyabs par gyur /
translated: At that time, she saved many merchants from the danger of a lion.

original: da ltar yang 'dis dge slong ma lnga brgya g-yon can gyi 'jigs pa las yongs su @130b bskyabs par byas so //
analyzed: da ltar yang 'dis dge slong ma lnga brgya g-yon can gyi 'jigs pa las yongs su @130b bskyabs par byas so //
translated: Now, she has saved five hundred nuns from the danger of a rogue.”

original: nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu gnyis pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu gnyis pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The twenty-second downfall is finished.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed at Jetavana, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park near Śrāvastī.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la soms shig /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la soms shig /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Nandī, you should think of the nuns.

original: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la rjes su ston cig /
analyzed: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma la rjes su ston cig /
translated: Nanda, you should instruct the nuns.🔽 Nanda, you should speak to the nuns with a Dharma talk.

original: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis shig ces bka' stsal nas de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dang tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed ga la ba der song ste phyin
analyzed: dga' byed khyod kyis dge slong ma rnams la chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis shig ces bka' stsal nas de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mi 'khor dge slong ma lnga brgya dang tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed ga la ba der song ste phyin
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī went to where the Venerable Nanda was, together with a retinue of five hundred nuns.

original: nas / tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: nas / tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: Having arrived, she bowed her head at the feet of the Venerable Nanda and sat to one side.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis de la don dang tshig dang yi ge zab pa zab pa dag gis chos bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis de la don dang tshig dang yi ge zab pa zab pa dag gis chos bstan to //
translated: The Venerable Nanda taught the Dharma to her with profound meanings, words, and letters.

original: bud med kyi yul ni shes rab 'chal ba'i phyir brda mi phrad cing 'jigs pa'i phyir 'dri mi nus so //
analyzed: bud med kyi yul ni shes rab 'chal ba'i phyir brda mi phrad cing 'jigs pa'i phyir 'dri mi nus so //
translated: Because women are of little wisdom, they cannot understand the meaning and are afraid to ask.

original: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mis /
analyzed: de nas skye dgu'i bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mis /
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī

original: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis smras pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas te /🔽tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas stan las langs te song nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyis smras pa la mngon par dga' ba dang rjes su yi rang ba byas te / tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed kyi rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas stan las langs te song nas /
translated: She rejoiced in and praised what the Venerable Nandaka had said.🔽She bowed low until her forehead touched the feet of the Venerable Nandaka, and then she got up from her seat, circumambulated him, and left.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /🔽mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te / mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: She went to the Blessed One, bowed low until her forehead touched his feet,🔽and then sat down to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das la skye dgu'i @131a *//
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas / bcom ldan 'das la skye dgu'i @131a *//
translated: When she had sat down to one side,🔽Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī

original: bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bdag mo chen mo go'u ta mis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa 'phags pa dga' byed kyis dge slong ma rnams la don dang tshig dang yi ge zab pa zab pa dag gis chos bstan na bud med kyi yul ni shes rab 'chal ba'i slad du brda mi 'jal cing 'jigs pa'i slad du 'dri ba'i rngo mi thog
analyzed: btsun pa 'phags pa dga' byed kyis dge slong ma rnams la don dang tshig dang yi ge zab pa zab pa dag gis chos bstan na bud med kyi yul ni shes rab 'chal ba'i slad du brda mi 'jal cing 'jigs pa'i slad du 'dri ba'i rngo mi thog
translated: “Venerable Nandaka taught the Dharma to the nuns with profound meanings, phrases, and letters, but women are stupid. Because of their stupidity, they did not understand the meaning, and because of their fear, they were unable to ask questions.

original: ste / bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i rgyu lags so zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: ste / bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin pa ni mi 'jigs pa'i rgyu lags so zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: “Blessed One, the Blessed One has said, ‘Generosity is the cause of fearlessness.’

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang na /
translated: If the Blessed One allows it,

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la kun dga' bar 'gyur ba dag bgyi'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la kun dga' bar 'gyur ba dag bgyi'o //
translated: the nuns will do things that please the monks.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de ltar na gnang gi /
analyzed: de ltar na gnang gi /
translated: “In that case, it is allowed.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la kun dga' bar 'gyur ba dag bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la kun dga' bar 'gyur ba dag bya'o //
translated: The nuns should do things that please the monks.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la kun dga' bar 'gyur ba dag bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma rnams kyis dge slong rnams la kun dga' bar 'gyur ba dag bya'o //
translated: “The Blessed One has said, ‘The nuns should do things that please the monks.’

original: zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: Thus he spoke.🔽🔽

original: de dag gis ji ltar bya ba dag mi shes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de dag gis ji ltar bya ba dag mi shes nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Since they did not know what to do, the Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, the nuns should do the following things that please the monks.

original: bca' ba lnga po rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag dang / bza' ba lnga po 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / 'de gu dang / sha dang / snum khur dag dang /
analyzed: bca' ba lnga po rtsa ba dang / sdong bu dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dag dang / bza' ba lnga po 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / 'de gu dang / sha dang / snum khur dag dang /
translated: The five foods are roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits. The five edibles are rice, barley, wheat, millet, and meat.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos dang / dra ba dang phor bu dang / shur bu dang lcag phod dang / shur bu phre'u dang / rgya cang dag gis bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos dang / dra ba dang phor bu dang / shur bu dang lcag phod dang / shur bu phre'u dang / rgya cang dag gis bya'o //
translated: The five articles are a begging bowl, a robe, a strainer, a water bottle, a sitting mat, a small knife, a razor, a needle, and a belt.

original: dge slong ma zhig gis 'o thug khyer te rgyal byed kyi tshal du song ba dang / drug sde dag gi kun tu spyod pa ni 'dir bdag cag gis bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs shing lhags pa la chos bstan par bya /
analyzed: dge slong ma zhig gis 'o thug khyer te rgyal byed kyi tshal du song ba dang / drug sde dag gi kun tu spyod pa ni 'dir bdag cag gis bram ze dang khyim bdag 'ongs shing lhags pa la chos bstan par bya /
translated: A nun took some milk-rice and went to Jetavana. The practice of the group of six was that when they saw a brahman or householder come, they would teach the Dharma to them.

original: rgol ba dag kyang @131b tshar gcad par bya /
analyzed: rgol ba dag kyang @131b tshar gcad par bya /
translated: They would also defeat opponents.

original: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrag par bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: rang gi grags pa yang bsgrag par bya'o snyam nas /
translated: They would also proclaim their own fame.

original: drug sde dag las gang yang rung bas rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgo stong par mi 'jog pas nye dga' nang par sngar langs te so shing bor nas snam sbyar dmar ser gyon te rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgo na 'chag cing 'dug go /
analyzed: drug sde dag las gang yang rung bas rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgo stong par mi 'jog pas nye dga' nang par sngar langs te so shing bor nas snam sbyar dmar ser gyon te rgyal byed kyi tshal gyi sgo na 'chag cing 'dug go /
translated: The group of six did not leave the gate to Jetavana empty. Udayi got up early in the morning, threw out his tooth stick, put on his red shawl, and sat walking back and forth at the gate to Jetavana.

original: nye dga' dge slong ma de mthong nas de la dris pa /
analyzed: nye dga' dge slong ma de mthong nas de la dris pa /
translated: When Udayi saw that nun, he asked her,

original: khyer te 'ongs pa 'di ci /
analyzed: khyer te 'ongs pa 'di ci /
translated: “What is this that you are carrying?”

original: 'o thug go /🔽su la blud /
analyzed: 'o thug go / su la blud /
translated: “Milk porridge.”

original: 'phags pa dga' byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa dga' byed do //
translated: “To whom will you give it?”🔽“To the noble Nandaka.”

original: gal te nye dgas kyang 'o thug rnyed par 'gyur na rtag pa kho nar dge slong ma la ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nye dgas kyang 'o thug rnyed par 'gyur na rtag pa kho nar dge slong ma la ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: “If Udayi could get milk porridge, he would always give it to the nuns.”

original: de bzhin du dge slong ma kha cig gis ni zho thug khyer te 'ongs /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong ma kha cig gis ni zho thug khyer te 'ongs /
translated: In the same way, some nuns brought curd porridge,

original: kha cig gis ni hvags kyi la du khyer te 'ongs pa dang / nye dgas smras pa /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni hvags kyi la du khyer te 'ongs pa dang / nye dgas smras pa /
translated: and some brought porridge with molasses. Udayi said,

original: kho bo ko tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed chos bzang po'i chos kyis dge slong ma la ston snyam gyi /
analyzed: kho bo ko tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed chos bzang po'i chos kyis dge slong ma la ston snyam gyi /
translated: “I think that the venerable Nandaka, with his good qualities, should teach the nuns.”

original: kho bo tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston snyam mi sems so //
analyzed: kho bo tshe dang ldan pa dga' byed zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston snyam mi sems so //
translated: “I, Venerable Nandīpāla, do not think to teach the nuns for the sake of a little food.”

original: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong ma rnams la 'di skad ces dge slong dag zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma rnams la ston par byed ces zer zhes smod par byed /
analyzed: dge slong don nyung du dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong ma rnams la 'di skad ces dge slong dag zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma rnams la ston par byed ces zer zhes smod par byed /
translated: “Why do the monks who have little to do say to the monks, ‘The monks teach the nuns for the sake of a little food’?”

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They criticized, spread it about, and made it notorious.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having given an exhortation with regard to this cause, this incident, this occasion, assembled the community of monks and asked the monks:🔽“Monks, is it true that the monks do this?”🔽“Monks, a donor or a group of donors has prepared a meal for the community of monks.

original: sangs rgyas @132a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas @132a *//
translated: Buddha

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye dga' la rmas pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye dga' la rmas pa /
translated: The Blessed One asked Upāli:

original: nye dga' khyod dge slong rnams la 'di skad ces dge slong dag ni zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston to zhes zer ba bden nam /
analyzed: nye dga' khyod dge slong rnams la 'di skad ces dge slong dag ni zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston to zhes zer ba bden nam /
translated: “Upāli, is it true that you said to the monks, ‘Monks teach the nuns for just a little food’?”

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Venerable, it is true.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: The Blessed Buddha criticized him, saying, “It is not proper for monks,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not suitable,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not fit,🔽it is not worthy of a renunciant.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
translated: This is not something a renunciant should do.”

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po ltar dregs pa dang bral ba /
translated: He was free from arrogance, like the king of elephants.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis legs par brgyan pa /
translated: He was well adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku rnam par mdzes pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku rnam par mdzes pa /
translated: His body was beautified with the eighty minor marks.

original: 'od 'dom gang gis gzugs can brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gis gzugs can brgyan pa /
translated: He was adorned with a fathom-wide halo,

original: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od dang ldan pa /
translated: and his radiance surpassed that of a thousand suns.

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba ltar kun tu bzang ba /
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba ltar kun tu bzang ba /
translated: He was as beautiful as a mountain of jewels.

original: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / ma 'gags pa dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / ma 'gags pa dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang /
translated: He possessed the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the three unique establishments of mindfulness, and great compassion. He was surrounded by many great hearers, such as Ājñātakauṇḍinya,🔽Vṛjiputra, Mahānāman, Aniruddha, Śāriputra,

original: mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po dang / 'od srung dang / kun dga' bo dang / nam gru la sogs pa nyan thos chen po dag dang / gzhan yang dge slong gi dge 'dun mang pos bskor te /
analyzed: mo'u dgal gyi bu chen po dang / 'od srung dang / kun dga' bo dang / nam gru la sogs pa nyan thos chen po dag dang / gzhan yang dge slong gi dge 'dun mang pos bskor te /
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana, Kāśyapa, Ānanda, Revata, and so forth, and by a great saṅgha of monks.

original: ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs so //
analyzed: ko sa la dag tu ljongs rgyur gshegs so //
translated: He was traveling through the country of Kosala.

original: chos nyid kyis na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag ljongs rgyur gshegs pa na 'ga' zhig chos gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ljongs rgyu bar mi 'gyur ram snyam nas /🔽sku thams cad kyis g-yas phyogs nas glang po che'i lta stangs kyis rnam par gzigs pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de chos gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs @135a *//
analyzed: chos nyid kyis na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag ljongs rgyur gshegs pa na 'ga' zhig chos gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa ljongs rgyu bar mi 'gyur ram snyam nas / sku thams cad kyis g-yas phyogs nas glang po che'i lta stangs kyis rnam par gzigs pa yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de chos gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs @135a *//
translated: It is natural that when the Blessed Buddhas travel through the country, they think, “Will anyone travel through the country without an upper robe and a lower robe?”

original: dang bcas pas ljongs rgyur 'gro ba gzigs so //
analyzed: dang bcas pas ljongs rgyur 'gro ba gzigs so //
translated: The Blessed One looked to the right with the gaze of an elephant and saw that the monk was traveling through the country with an upper robe and a lower robe.

original: gzigs nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Having seen this, he said to the venerable Ānanda,

original: kun dga' bo dge slong dbyar gnas bdag gis chos gos kyi rnyed pa ma grub bam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong dbyar gnas bdag gis chos gos kyi rnyed pa ma grub bam /
translated: “Ānanda, did the monk who stayed during the rainy season not obtain a robe?”

original: bcom ldan 'das grub bo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das grub bo //
translated: “Blessed One, he did.”

original: kun dga' bo 'o na ci'i phyir dge slong 'di chos gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pas ljongs rgyur 'gro /
analyzed: kun dga' bo 'o na ci'i phyir dge slong 'di chos gos stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pas ljongs rgyur 'gro /
translated: “Ānanda, why is this monk traveling through the country with an upper robe and a lower robe?”🔽“Blessed One, this monk did not obtain a robe.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos skabs de bcom ldan 'das la rgyas par gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo dge slong dag dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la gos dag sbyin nam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong dag dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la gos dag sbyin nam /
translated: “Ānanda, do the monks give robes to nuns who are not relatives?”

original: btsun pa stsol to //
analyzed: btsun pa stsol to //
translated: “They do, Bhadanta.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa ni 'di snyam du 'di'i chos gos gsum tshang ngam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa ni 'di snyam du 'di'i chos gos gsum tshang ngam /
translated: “Ānanda, a nun who is not a relative does not think, ‘Is her set of three robes complete?

original: 'on te ma tshang snyam du mi sems par 'di ltar thob bo cog len par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'on te ma tshang snyam du mi sems par 'di ltar thob bo cog len par byed kyi /
translated: Or is it incomplete?’ But she takes whatever she gets.

original: nye du la ni byin yang len par mi byed do //
analyzed: nye du la ni byin yang len par mi byed do //
translated: But if it is a relative, she does not take it even if it is given.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, due to this incident, this occasion, assembled the saṅgha of monks

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and so on, as above.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The Buddha Bhagavāns, knowing, ask.

original: sangs rgyas @135b bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de la rmas pa /🔽dge slong khyod dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la gos sbyin pa bden nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas @135b bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong de la rmas pa / dge slong khyod dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la gos sbyin pa bden nam /
translated: The Buddha Bhagavān asked the bhikṣu:

original: btsun ma mad do //
analyzed: btsun ma mad do //
translated: “Bhikṣu, is it true that you, not a relative, gave cloth to a bhikṣuṇī?”🔽“Venerable, it is true.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha Bhagavān reproved him, saying:

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: “This is not fitting for one gone forth,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not allowed,🔽it is not to be done.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: This is not proper for one gone forth.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad pa mdzad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad pa mdzad nas /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, having reproved him in many ways,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: addressed the bhikṣus:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Therefore, monks, having seen ten benefits, I establish a basis of training for disciples in the poṣadha ceremony, and so on, as before.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon bar bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon bar bya ste /
translated: My disciples should recite this basis of training in the poṣadha ceremony:

original: yang dge slong gang dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la gos sbyin na ltung byed do /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la gos sbyin na ltung byed do /
translated: ‘If a monk gives a robe to a nun who is not a relative, he commits a minor offense.’”

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa'o //
translated: “Monk” means a follower of this doctrine.

original: dge slong ma zhes bya ba yang chos 'di pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma zhes bya ba yang chos 'di pa'o //
translated: “Nun” also means a follower of this doctrine.

original: nye du ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni phyi mo dang mes po dang phrugs pa las brten pa'i bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa la zhes bya ba ni phyi mo dang mes po dang phrugs pa las brten pa'i bdun pa tshun chad ni nye du yin la de phan chad ni nye du ma yin no //
translated: “Not a relative” means that up to seven generations of ancestors and descendants are relatives, but beyond that they are not relatives.

original: gos zhes bya ba ni bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / ko tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos dag las gang yang rung ba'o //🔽sbyin na zhes bya ba @136a *//
analyzed: gos zhes bya ba ni bdun po bal gos dang / sha na'i gos dang / zar ma'i gos dang / du gu la'i gos dang / ras bal gyi gos dang / ko tam pa'i gos dang / nyi 'og gi gos dag las gang yang rung ba'o // sbyin na zhes bya ba @136a *//
translated: “Cloth” means any of the seven types of cloth: wool, linen, cotton, silk, coarse cloth, felt, or gauze.

original: ni bslang ba mi dgos par ro //
analyzed: ni bslang ba mi dgos par ro //
translated: “If he gives it” means if he gives it without being asked.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: “Offense” means that he will be burned, cooked, and fallen into the hells, the animal realm, and the world of the hungry ghosts—the bad places, the lower realms, and the unfortunate destinies.🔽“Burned” means that he will be burned.

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Cooked” means that he will be cooked.🔽“Fallen” means that he will be fallen.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, as long as that offense is not confessed and does not go away, it is an obscuration to wholesome dharmas.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one come to offend?

original: dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la nye du ma yin par 'du shes pas gos sbyin na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la yid gnyis za bas gos byin na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la nye du ma yin par 'du shes pas gos sbyin na ltung byed du 'gyur ro // dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la yid gnyis za bas gos byin na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk gives a robe to a non-relative nun, thinking she is a non-relative, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If a fully ordained monk gives a robe to a non-relative nun, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du la nye du ma yin par 'du shes pas gos byin na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du la nye du ma yin par 'du shes pas gos byin na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk gives a robe to a relative nun, thinking she is a non-relative, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du la nye du ma yin par yid gnyis za bas gos byin na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong ma nye du la nye du ma yin par yid gnyis za bas gos byin na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk gives a robe to a relative nun, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bor brlag byung ba la sbyin pa dang / legs par smra ba la sbyin pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la gos kyi sbyin pa dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa la sbyin pa dang / rin gyi phyir sbyin pa dang / brje ba'i phyir sbyin pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: bor brlag byung ba la sbyin pa dang / legs par smra ba la sbyin pa dang / dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la gos kyi sbyin pa dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa la sbyin pa dang / rin gyi phyir sbyin pa dang / brje ba'i phyir sbyin pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he gives to one who has lost her own; if he gives to one who speaks well of the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Sangha; if he gives to the Sangha of nuns; if he gives to one who is in the process of being fully admitted; if he gives in exchange for a price; or if he gives in exchange for something else.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginner; if he is insane; if his mind is disturbed; if he is in pain; if he is the first offender.

original: gos sbyin pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu bzhi pa rdzogs so ////🔽'dul ba rnam @136b par 'byed pa /
analyzed: gos sbyin pa'i ltung byed de nyi shu bzhi pa rdzogs so //// 'dul ba rnam @136b par 'byed pa /
translated: The twenty-fourth training rule is finished.🔽The chapter on the nuns

original: bam po zhe dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po zhe dgu pa /
translated: The ninety-second training rule

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: dge slong ma sbed ma'i chos gos lnga ngan cing snam sbyar yang rnyings nas /
analyzed: dge slong ma sbed ma'i chos gos lnga ngan cing snam sbyar yang rnyings nas /
translated: The nun Siṃha had five poor robes and an old patched robe.

original: des ras yug chen zhig rnyed pa dang / de su zhig bdag gi chos gos 'tshem par 'gyur snyam du sems khong du chud cing 'dug pa na /
analyzed: des ras yug chen zhig rnyed pa dang / de su zhig bdag gi chos gos 'tshem par 'gyur snyam du sems khong du chud cing 'dug pa na /
translated: She found a large piece of cloth, and she wondered, “Who will sew a robe for me?”

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis de la smras pa /
translated: The nuns asked her,

original: sbed ma khyod ci'i phyir sems khong du chud cing 'dug /
analyzed: sbed ma khyod ci'i phyir sems khong du chud cing 'dug /
translated: “Siṃha, why are you so downcast?”

original: phu nu mo dag kho mo chos gos lnga ngan cing snam sbyar yang rnyings nas /
analyzed: phu nu mo dag kho mo chos gos lnga ngan cing snam sbyar yang rnyings nas /
translated: “Sisters, my five robes are poor and my patched robe is old.

original: kho mos ras yug chen po zhig rnyed na /
analyzed: kho mos ras yug chen po zhig rnyed na /
translated: If she finds a large piece of cloth,

original: kho mo'i chos gos su 'drub par 'gyur mi shes so //
analyzed: kho mo'i chos gos su 'drub par 'gyur mi shes so //
translated: she will make it into a Dharma robe.

original: sbed ma khyod gser gyi snod kyi slong mo la rgyu'am /
analyzed: sbed ma khyod gser gyi snod kyi slong mo la rgyu'am /
translated: “Are you, Bhadrā, begging for a golden bowl?

original: khyod kyi dge slong 'phags pa 'char ka rab tu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi dge slong 'phags pa 'char ka rab tu shes pa yin no //
translated: You know the noble monk Udayin very well.”

original: sbed mas smras pa /
analyzed: sbed mas smras pa /
translated: Bhadrā said,

original: des kho mo'i chos gos drubs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kho mo'i chos gos drubs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “He will not make a Dharma robe for me.”

original: khyod kyis de lan 'ga' bcol ba yod dam /
analyzed: khyod kyis de lan 'ga' bcol ba yod dam /
translated: “Have you ever asked him?”

original: lan 'ga' yang bcol ba med do //
analyzed: lan 'ga' yang bcol ba med do //
translated: “I have never asked him.”

original: ci khyod chu sgra grags pas lham 'bud dam /
analyzed: ci khyod chu sgra grags pas lham 'bud dam /
translated: “Do you take off your shoes when the sound of water is heard?”

original: song la chol cig dang 'drub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: song la chol cig dang 'drub par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Go and ask him. He will make it.”

original: sbed ma 'char ka'i gan du song ste /
analyzed: sbed ma 'char ka'i gan du song ste /
translated: Bhadrā went to Udayin,

original: de'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas de'i ras yug chen mthong nas des smras pa /
analyzed: de'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas de'i ras yug chen mthong nas des smras pa /
translated: bowed her head at his feet, and sat down in front of him. The venerable Udayin saw her large piece of cloth and said,

original: sbed ma gang la ras yug chen 'di lta bu yod pa des ni /
analyzed: sbed ma gang la ras yug chen 'di lta bu yod pa des ni /
translated: “Bhadrā, whoever has such a large piece of cloth

original: sar pa las snam sbyar nyis rim byas te snying las chung @137a *//
analyzed: sar pa las snam sbyar nyis rim byas te snying las chung @137a *//
translated: The new monk should wear the patched robe in two layers, and should not be too active.🔽

original: ngus  dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngus  dge ba'i phyogs la tron byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The new one will be made into a two-layered patched robe and I will be able to work for the side of virtue with little difficulty.”

original: sped mas smras pa /
analyzed: sped mas smras pa /
translated: The miserly one said,

original: 'phags pa bdag khyod la ras yug chen mi 'bul ba ni ma lags na /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag khyod la ras yug chen mi 'bul ba ni ma lags na /
translated: “Noble one, it’s not that I won’t offer you a large piece of cloth,

original: 'di ltar bdag gis chos gos lnga ngan cing snam sbyar yang rnyings pas khyod kyis bdag gi snam sbyar tshems te stsol cig /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis chos gos lnga ngan cing snam sbyar yang rnyings pas khyod kyis bdag gi snam sbyar tshems te stsol cig /
translated: but since my five Dharma robes are poor and my patched robe is old, you should take my patched robe and give it to me.”

original: 'char kas bsams pa /
analyzed: 'char kas bsams pa /
translated: Udayin thought,

original: gal te re zhig btsem par byar yang bcu gnyis sde dag las gang dang gang dag la chos gos btsem par bya ba byung bar gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang bdag gi gan du khyer te 'ong bas de snyed cig btsem par yang ji ltar nus /
analyzed: gal te re zhig btsem par byar yang bcu gnyis sde dag las gang dang gang dag la chos gos btsem par bya ba byung bar gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang bdag gi gan du khyer te 'ong bas de snyed cig btsem par yang ji ltar nus /
translated: “If I were to sew it, since all of the twelve groups of nuns would bring their robes to me to sew, how could I possibly sew that many?

original: gal te mi btsem du ni tshig pa'i g-yar tshul kyang mi ster bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te mi btsem du ni tshig pa'i g-yar tshul kyang mi ster bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If I don’t sew it, they won’t give me the opportunity to beg for alms.”

original: 'di ltar ci nas kyang shing gi snod du bskol ba bzhin du dang po gang yin pa de nyid tha mar 'gyur ba de ltar btsem par bya'o snyam nas /🔽des de la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci nas kyang shing gi snod du bskol ba bzhin du dang po gang yin pa de nyid tha mar 'gyur ba de ltar btsem par bya'o snyam nas / des de la smras pa /

translated: “The Blessed One laid down this training rule for the monks: ‘If a monk travels by appointment with a group of nuns, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' rab na bzhugs so //🔽dge slong ma rab tu mang po dag rgyal po'i khab tu dge slong ma'i dbyar khang rgyal @142a *//

translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī.🔽Many monks had accepted the invitation to stay during the rainy season in the nuns’ dwelling in Rājagṛha.

analyzed: po'i kun dga' ra ba na dbyar gnas par khas blangs nas de dag dbyar gyi zla ba gsum po dag 'das nas /
translated: After the three months of the rainy season had passed,

translated: They set out for Śrāvastī to bow down to the Blessed One’s feet. They began to look for a caravan going to Śrāvastī, and when they saw a caravan with monks, they said,

analyzed: phu nu mo dag don mthun 'di ni dge slong dang bcas pa yin gyi /

translated: “We’ll go with this caravan.” They went with the caravan for just a little while,🔽and then they went on ahead. When the caravan had gone a long way, the bandits attacked it.🔽The merchants eventually arrived in Śrāvastī and went to the nuns’ rainy season retreat house.

original: ji ltar bde bar brgyus /
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar brgyus /

original: bdag cag chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo //
analyzed: bdag cag chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo //

analyzed: phu nu mo dag ji ltar bdag cag bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su btang ba de ltar ni ya mtshan can dgu bcu rtsa drug po dag @142b gis kyang bud med kyi yul 'ga' yang yongs su ma btang ngo zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong ma rnams

analyzed: btsun pa mad do //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /🔽rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa / rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked him,

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: saying, “Udayin, this is not fitting for a renunciant, it is not suitable, it is not proper, it is not worthy, it is not allowable, it is not to be done.🔽How can you, Udayin, stand alone with a fully ordained nun in a private, secluded place?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: After rebuking him in many ways, the Buddha addressed the monks:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Monks, I see many benefits in establishing a training rule for my disciples, the monks, to train like this: ‘One should not stand alone with a fully ordained nun in a private, secluded place.’ And so on as above.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste; yang dge slong gang dge slong ma dang lhan cig gcig pu gcig dang dben pa skyabs yod pa na 'greng na ltung byed do //🔽yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka'am /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste; yang dge slong gang dge slong ma dang lhan cig gcig pu gcig dang dben pa skyabs yod pa na 'greng na ltung byed do // yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni 'char ka'am /
translated: “My disciples, you should recite this training rule: ‘If a monk stands alone with a fully ordained nun in private, out of sight, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”🔽As to “If a monk,” it refers to a monk like Upāli.

original: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //🔽dge slong ma dang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa dang ngo //🔽lhan cig ces bya ba ni de de dang lhan cig go /
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o // dge slong ma dang zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pa dang ngo // lhan cig ces bya ba ni de de dang lhan cig go /
translated: As to “a monk,” it refers to Upāli or any other monk.🔽As to “a fully ordained nun,” it refers to a nun who is fully ordained according to the Dharma.

original: gcig pu gcig dang zhes bya ba @153b ni de de dang ngo //
analyzed: gcig pu gcig dang zhes bya ba @153b ni de de dang ngo //
translated: As to “alone with,” it refers to just the monk and the nun.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ni gang na skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gzhan 'ga' yang med pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ni gang na skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gzhan 'ga' yang med pa'o //
translated: As to “in private, out of sight,” it refers to where there is no man.

original: skyabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni lngas bskyabs pa na ste /
analyzed: skyabs yod pa zhes bya ba ni lngas bskyabs pa na ste /
translated: As to “in a concealed place,” it refers to a place concealed by five things.

original: rtsig pas bskyabs pa dang / rib mas bskyabs pa dang / yol bas bskyabs pa dang / thibs pos bskyabs pa dang / mtshan mos bskyabs pa na'o //
analyzed: rtsig pas bskyabs pa dang / rib mas bskyabs pa dang / yol bas bskyabs pa dang / thibs pos bskyabs pa dang / mtshan mos bskyabs pa na'o //
translated: when protected by a wall, when protected by a screen, when protected by a curtain, when protected by a thicket, when protected by a tree, when protected by a lamp.

original: 'greng na zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang gi nang na 'greng na'o //
analyzed: 'greng na zhes bya ba ni 'dom gang gi nang na 'greng na'o //
translated: “Standing” means: standing within an arm’s reach.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed //🔽'tshod par byed; ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed // 'tshod par byed; ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “Offense entailing confession” means: it is burned, cooked, and fallen into the lower realms, bad rebirths, and the hells.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: “Further” means: as long as that offense is not confessed and is not disclosed, it obscures the wholesome dharmas.

original: des na ltung byed do //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is called an “offense entailing confession.”

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is stated thus.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is there an offense here?

original: dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad dge slong ma dang lhan cig gcig pu gcig dang dben pa skyabs yod pa na 'greng na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽sgo khang na 'greng ba dang / sman 'thag tu 'jud pa dang / sgo ma bcad par 'greng ba dang / gzhan dag 'jug cing gzhan dag 'byung ba na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong gis ji tsam cung zad dge slong ma dang lhan cig gcig pu gcig dang dben pa skyabs yod pa na 'greng na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro // sgo khang na 'greng ba dang / sman 'thag tu 'jud pa dang / sgo ma bcad par 'greng ba dang / gzhan dag 'jug cing gzhan dag 'byung ba na ltung ba med do //
translated: A monk who stands alone with a nun in a concealed place, in any of the following situations, commits an offense:🔽There is no offense if he stands in the doorway; if he stands while she is weaving a robe; if the door is open; if others are present;

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: if he is a beginner; if he is insane; if he is the first offender;

original: gcig pu 'greng ba'i ltung byed de nyi shu dgu pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: gcig pu 'greng ba'i ltung byed de nyi shu dgu pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The twenty-ninth offense entailing suspension is finished.

analyzed: @154a *// sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen pos cang mi smra bas bcom ldan 'das las mnyan to //

translated: Then the Venerable Mahākāśyapa rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One's words, bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet, and left.

analyzed: de'i tshe na mnyan yod na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa de la yun ring po nas smon pa 'di lta bu skyes te kye ma bdag gis gnas brtan 'od srung chen po lha dang mis mchod pa khyim gzhan du spyan drangs te bshos gsol na ci ma rung
translated: At that time, there was a householder in Śrāvastī who had long harbored this aspiration: “Oh, how wonderful it would be if I could invite the elder Mahākāśyapa, revered by gods and humans, to my home and offer him a meal.”

analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin tu 'jug par byed /

analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod par byed /

analyzed: bdag gis de dag nyid dang bzhi spyan drangs ngo snyam mo //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po la 'di skad ces smras so //

translated: Then the householder, knowing that the venerable Mahākāśyapa had accepted by remaining silent, bowed his head at the venerable Mahākāśyapa's feet and left. He went to his own house

analyzed: kho bos de bdag nyid dang bzhi sang khyim gzhan du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs na des kyang cang mi gsung bas gnang gi /
translated: Since he has assented by his silence to my invitation to him and his three companions to another’s house for a meal tomorrow,

analyzed: zhal zas bsod pa mang po dag sta gon gyis shig /

analyzed: khyim bdag gi chung ma des khyim bdag las mnyan nas / kha zas grang cha gang dag yin pa de dag ni de nyid kyi nyin mo sta gon byas /
translated: The householder’s wife listened to the householder.🔽The cold foods were prepared that very day,

analyzed: dro bag gang dag yin pa de dag ni phyi de nyin par @155b sta gon byas nas /

translated: So he should arrange the seats on the middle ground.

translated: Then he arranged the seats on the middle ground and sent a message to the venerable Mahā­kāśyapa:

analyzed: btsun pa 'od srung chen po gdugs tshod g-yar dgongs 'tshal na de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol zhes bskul to //

analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /

analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed do //
translated: He satisfied him.

original: de nas dge @156a *//
analyzed: de nas dge @156a *//
